Hi,

Three newbie questions:

1) As I understand it, (fully connected) NEAT=
 starts out with 
just one bias node -  is that right?

2) Would there be a=
ny advantage in adding a feature where NEAT
could mutate node types from hi=
dden to bias - i.e. to increase the
 overall chances of more links from bia=
s nodes being created ?

3)Lastly, (there may be no right answer to this on=
e, but if there is a
convention in NEAT I would like to follow it) If I sta=
rt with an
initial  population of genomes, each fully connected to the outp=
uts,
then perturb the weights, before dong any crosssover/mutations - is
th=
at population at that stage referred to as generation zero or
generation on=
e?

Thanks in advance

Mike
